Layouts & Positioning

Fixed Positioning

A fixed element is positioned relative to the viewport (the user’s visible area of a web page), which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled.

The box offset properties of top, right, bottom, and left properties are used.

.fixed-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
}

If you are applying position fixed to create a ‘sticky navigation’ as shown in the codepen above, you will want to adjust the padding on the body element to push the first content down below the header.

See the Pen Fixed Positoning by The Institute of Code (@instituteofcode) on CodePen.
